comments:
3.0 RC3.

I was playing with the org.eclipse.core.tools.resources project. (moving it and
the org.eclipse.core.tools project from an internal server to dev)

Not sure what I did to cause it...I run with -consoleLog but the console was
covered over since I had maximized my window. I had been using the plug-in and
manifest.mf editors.

Should I re-open this report or enter a new one? Nothing was reported to the
user so even if its user error then we should improve feedback.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Jun 21, 2004 17:05:07.710

/org.eclipse.core.tools.resources

Sorry, the comment "should I re-open this report" was in reference to bug 37117.

Cherie, use your imagination to figure out how my good friend DJ could have 
encountered this problem and fix it for 3.1 only.

This exception occurs due to the way the build properties editor used to handle
the '.' (root directory) token in bin.includes.

Luckily, the problem was solved in the process of fixing Bug 68023 :)

I tried to reproduce it on I0811 and the 3.0 release without problems.  If the
problem happens again on a current release, please reopen.

Going to resolve as invalid even though it was previously valid :-)
A better resolution in this case would have been WORKSFORME.

Doh!

Duly noted for the next time.

Thanks, Wassim!
